CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 3, 1962, pg. 1, reads: "Over 2,000 - over 2,000 persons attended and applauded inspiring words and songs of the first Appreciation Day Rally of The Pittsburgh Courier. The event was held in Oakland's SOldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall, on Sunday.  Speakers stirringly reviewed the historic past of the Negro, the present state and then issued a ringing challenge to Negroes to become active pursuers of first-class citizenship.  (Story on Page 3, Section - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Audience of women and men seated in Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall, with empty seats on right, for Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper's Appreciation Day Rally
